text: Cytomegalovirus modulates <extra_id_0> interleukin-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression .
Complications after lung transplantation include the development of rejection and an increased incidence of infection , particularly with cytomegalovirus ( CMV ) .
Several recent studies have suggested that <extra_id_0> interleukin (IL)-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may be used to detect both infection and rejection after lung transplantation .
In addition , <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may play a role in the development of bronchiolitis obliterans after transplantation .

Because CMV is also associated with the development of bronchiolitis obliterans after transplantation , we determined whether CMV induces <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression .
We demonstrated that CMV infection increased both <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein and mRNA in peripheral blood mononuclear cells .

We also demonstrated that the CMV <extra_id_0> immediate early 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene product increased expression of the <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

This effect of the CMV <extra_id_0> immediate early 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene product was dependent upon the presence of specific transcription factor binding sites in the <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

These studies demonstrate that CMV may be an important cofactor in the development of rejection and infection after transplantation through its effects on <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
